Articles.Content: Is there any chance to migrate my game to Steam? All of my games are on online platforms (Steam, Origin) because it's easier to track and store them.

If you have a game key, you can go into your steam library Ã‚Â» bottom left corner, click on the "+ Add game..." button Ã‚Â» Activate a steam product Ã‚Â» Put your key there, and the game should be added to your Steam library.

If you don't have a key, you'll need to contact Squad.

Afair there is a button on your product list on KSP's website saying 'migrate to steam'. So yeah, if you want to sell your sould for a bit of comfort, that's easy to do. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Thanks for the info, I'll try this.
Note, steam transfer is only available if you bought the game before it went on steam. Games bought from the KSP store after KSP went to stream are not transferable.
Is steam migration really available?? I'd like to do that too but can't find such a button on the ksp store page.

Btw, you can add the KSP executable to steam if you just want it in the library (its the same place like 'activate product').

> 
> Note, steam transfer is only available if you bought the game before it went on steam. Games bought from the KSP store after KSP went to stream are not transferable.

Yeah, that might be true. My info is a bit out of date. Maybe writing to support might be the thing to do?

> 
> Yeah, that might be true. My info is a bit out of date. Maybe writing to support might be the thing to do?

As far as I understood, only having pre-steam sales transfer to steam was part of the steam deal.

If you can you see this:

![pMbBMEc.png](http://i.imgur.com/pMbBMEc.png)

If you cannot, then you are out of luck.
I wrote a letter to the support, we'll see in a couple of hours/days ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Squad does not offer Steam keys or migration to Steam for purchases that occurred after Marth 20th 2013, sorry.

[**Link**](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/en/?page_id=19)

> 
> I bought the game on the KSP Store, but I want it on Steam. Will you give me a Steam Key?
> Yes, we now offer the choice to transfer KSP purchases from before the game was available on Steam, note that this process is OPTIONAL and IRREVERSIBLE. If you transfer your purchase to Steam, you will no longer be able to download or update the game from the KSPStore, but also nobodyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s forcing you to go to Steam, if you opt not to transfer, you can still download and update the game as usual. To move to Steam, log in to your KSPStore profile and you will find the button to start the process next to your download link. If you canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t see the button in your profile it means you purchased the game after it was on Steam and you are not eligible, no exceptions, please donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t insist. As you can see in our Steam store page, the release date for Steam is March 20th 2013.
Why not? I already brought the game, why does it matter where I store?
Squad does not give Steam keys except to early adopters and even they lose their store copy if they migrate, that is why.
Steam keys are a Steam product. Squad does not own them to give away.

darn, I thought I had purchased ksp before that but I guess not. Only thing I would have wanted steam for would have been the easy updates - but maybe, someday, the patcher will work.. someday. Maybe.
